events.message: The insured has reported a car accident involving their vehicle rear-ending another car at a stoplight.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident as the incident involved a vehicle collision on a public road.
An insurance agent has been assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the accident claim process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and informed the customer about next steps.
The insurer requested necessary documents including accident police report, photos of the vehicle damage and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documentation such as police report, pictures of damages and a copy of the repair estimate.
The claim investigation phase began, including review of submitted documents and contacting witnesses to confirm accident details.
Investigation concluded with findings that the policyholder was not at fault and the vehicle damage was fully confirmed.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount to cover all repair costs for the vehicle involved in the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed gratitude for the prompt and fair handling of their claim.
The claim received final approval from the claims department, authorizing the release of payment for the vehicle damages.
Payment was issued to the repair shop on behalf of the insured, ensuring that the vehicle can be restored without delay.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation from the customer that the repairs have been completed satisfactorily.
All case files and documentation related to the auto accident claim were archived in the company records for future reference.
